page.title: 05ROYAL VISIT, LITTLE URSWICK.
page.content: Urswick Grammar School celebrates its Quartercentenary year. On May 24th 1985 Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth 11 visited Urswick Grammar School to see an exhibition about life in Elizabeth 1's reign. She was greeted by four children, Gavin Phillips,Joe Bone and Victoria Stable and Mary Macance presented her with an Elizabethan posy of flowers. The Queen watched a team of Maypole dancers with music by Kirsty Lydon and Rachel Attwell on violins. Some of Mr. Jepson's and Mrs. Norton's class demonstrated the dance "La Volta" (Queen Elizabeth 1 favourite dance). In the school hall the Queen inspected work displayed and spoke to the children. Then the Queen was presented with gifts. Mr. Beechem escorted her.
